snippet: A ProPublica analysis found that many health insurance plans offered in the federal marketplace are changing their benefits heading into 2015.
abstract: ProPublica analysis of 2014 and 2015 health care plans being offered on federal government's health insurance exchange in 34 states shows that many plans have made changes that could markedly affect how much consumers pay; people seeking health care on exchange face complex battery of choices as they pick plans for 2015.

byline.original: By CHARLES ORNSTEIN, RYANN GROCHOWSKI JONES and LENA GROEGER

lead_paragraph: A ProPublica analysis found that many health insurance plans offered in the federal marketplace are changing their benefits heading into 2015.

headline.print_headline: Hidden in the Fine Print, Big Changes in Some ’15 Health Plans
headline.main: Big Changes in Fine Print of Some 2015 Health Plans

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
